data.title: Gilan Province – Iran Travel Guide
data.meta_description: Posts about Gilan Province written by irantravelingcenter
data.text:
Tag: Gilan Province

Heyran Tourism Village

As one of the most beautiful tourist area in Iran, “Heyran Tourism Village” is located 35 Km from Astara county in Gilan Province. The village built by the private sector has many facilities such as cable car, carting, trampolines, pavilions, restaurants, coffee shops, traditional tea houses and waterfront. Heyran is one of the most famous … More Heyran Tourism Village

Chaboksar

Chaboksar is a beautiful city and the capital of Chaboksar District, in Rudsar County, Gilan Province, Iran.

Heyran Gondola Lift (Telecabin)

Heyran Gondola lift is in the region of Gilan Province and the city of Bandar-e-Astara near by Heyran Village. Construction of Heyran Gondola Lift is an important step towards the development of Tourism in Gilan. Heyran Gondola lift is 1500 meters long and its beautiful landscape toward east ends to Caspian Sea and Astara and … More Heyran Gondola Lift (Telecabin)

Masal County

Masal County pleases tourists to the fullest. Located on the out skirts of Talesh Mountain Range in Gilan province, Masal county is one of the great places to visit in Iran. Masal county is divided in two districts, namely, central District and shanderman. Several incredible landscapes in Masal thrill tourists in all seasons of the … More Masal County

A Paradise along Iran’s Khalkhal-Asalem

On a recent day in Loomavesht, a Village up the Asalem-Khalkhal road in north of Iran’s Gilan province, the men shear sheep, and the women clean the wool. Cool mists fills the air, and soon the cold water will drive most of the villagers and their livestock down the Alborz mountains to live out the … More A Paradise along Iran’s Khalkhal-Asalem

Zahed Gilani’s Tomb

Zahed Gilani’s Tomb, Gilan, Iran. – Since the mid 13th century, Sheikh Zahed is revered as a spiritual authority and his tomb near Lahijan in Iran’s Gilan Province, on the shores of the Caspian Sea, draws numerous pilgrims to the picturesque village of Sheikhanvar. His ancestors hailed from the ancient Iranian city of Sanjan in … More Zahed Gilani’s Tomb
